priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Biospecimen Characteristics Test Name Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C124299

self.title: CDISC SDTM Biospecimen Characteristics Test Name Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the test names that describe the characteristics of biospecimens and extracted samples.
name: Biospecimen Characteristics Test Name
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Biospecimen Characteristics Test Name Terminology

terms.definition: An assessment of nucleic acid purity that is measured by determining the ratio of light absorbance of the nucleic acid sample at 260nm and 230nm respectively.
An assessment of nucleic acid purity that is measured by determining the ratio of light absorbance of the nucleic acid sample at 260nm and 280nm respectively.
The extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary. (NCI)
The quantity of a specified substance in a unit volume or weight of another substance.
The name of the substance or material that preserves tissues and cells for study.
The type of fluorescent label or dye that is used in a fluorescence-based assay.
The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end. (NCI)
The amount of matter in an object.
An assessment of excellence, worth, or fitness for use.
A numerical assessment of the integrity of RNA based on the entire electrophoretic trace of the RNA sample, including the presence or absence of degradation products. (NCI)
An indication as to whether the sample contains viable (capable of life or normal growth and development) cells or tissues.
A measurement of the percent of a sample that is viable (capable of life or normal growth and development) for further processing or testing.
A measurement of the weight of a biological specimen.

The property of a body or region of space that determines whether or not there will be a net flow of heat into it or out of it from a neighboring body or region and in which direction (if any) the heat will flow, perceptible by living organism as a somatic sensation of cold or heat. It is a measure of the average translational kinetic energy associated with the disordered microscopic motion of atoms and molecules. Temperature is measured in one of the three standard temperature scales: Celsius, Kelvin, and Fahrenheit. (NCI)
The dimension between two surfaces of an object, usually the smallest dimension as opposed to the width or the length.
A characterization of the tumor tissue sample based upon whether it was taken from a tumor that originated after the disease spread.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container. (NCI)
The extent or measurement of something from side to side. (NCI)
